properties.Description: In 1917, Shattuck Hall was built as an elementary school, and in 1971, it was acquired by Portland State University. Some of the renovations included converting a dance studio into a lecture hall (and to date, the dance floor is still located under the carpet), and a swimming pool located in the basement was utilized for book storage. The building now houses our professionally accredited Architecture Department, and there are also labs and studio spaces for the use of architecture students.
properties.Name: Shattuck Hall

properties.Description: The main lobby of Neuberger Hall houses the help windows and offices of Financial Aid, Cashier, ID Services, and the Office of the Registrar. There are computers for students to access their records online. The departments of English, Foreign Languages and Literature, Conflict Resolution, Math, Philosophy, Speech and Hearing Sciences can be found in Neuberger Hall.
properties.Name: Neuberger Hall

properties.Description: Smith Memorial Student Union, the campus student union, is a four-story building with two basement levels. It was built in four separate phases between 1956 and 1963. The building houses Viking Food Court, ASPSU-Associated Students of Portland State University, Multicultural Center and La Casa Latina, 100 student organizations in Student Activities and Leadership Programs, ASPSU Childcare and our student run and Diversity and Multicultural Student Services.
properties.Name: Smith Memorial Student Union

properties.Description: Cramer Hall was built in four sections. It houses most of our ology departments, such as Anthropology, Geology, Geography, Psychology and Sociology. It also houses Economics and History. Both the PSU Writing Center and the University Studies departments are located on the first floor.
properties.Name: Cramer Hall

properties.Description: The recently renovated Lincoln Hall used to be Lincoln High School, and was the first building to be used on our current campus. PSU started in 1946 as the Vanport Extension Center for G.I.'s returning from World War II. It was located in the neighborhood of Vanport, a site of vacant housing for shipyard workers, but the Columbia River flood of 1948 forced the center to move. Lincoln Hall was acquired for the university's new home in 1952. Some of the only items salvaged from the flood were a rock and some library books. Students placed the newly named Vanport Rock at the Park Block entrance to Lincoln Hall to show that they wouldn't be moved again. Lincoln Hall now holds the offices for the College of the Arts.
properties.Name: Lincoln Hall

properties.Description: The Science Research and Teaching Center (SRTC) houses the Biology, Chemistry, Environmental Studies, and Physics departments. There are special computer labs for the science departments, and a Chemical Consortium for student access. There is also a Vertebrae Biology Museum on the second floor.
properties.Name: Science Research and Teaching Center

properties.Description: Harrison Hall was renamed to Hoffmann Hall in 1998 in honor of alumnus and former professor George C. Hoffmann. This building has the second largest lecture hall, which seats up to 400.
properties.Name: Hoffmann Hall

properties.Description: The Peter W. Stott Center houses Portland State University's Athletics Department as well as physical education classes. It features covered outdoor tennis courts and a running track on the roof, a rock wall, racquetball courts, a range room that doubles as batting cages, a weight room, a circuit training room, and a junior-Olympic sized pool.
properties.Name: Peter Stott Center & Community Recreation Field

properties.Description: The Millar Library is part of PORTALS (Portland Area Library Systems) which is a library consortium, and is also a part of the interlibrary loan system. Students can go to other university and college libraries around Oregon and borrow books that PSU may not have, and request for them to be sent to the Millar Library. Our library has many computers for students to use, several quiet floors, a number of study rooms, and the Learning Center.
properties.Name: Branford P. Millar Library

properties.Description: The Native American Student and Community Center opened in October 2003. The center is the only one of its kind in the Portland metropolitan region, which is home to 20,000 American Indian and Alaska Natives. It serves as a cultural home for native students, supporting their enrollment at PSU and enhancing their academic studies.
properties.Name: Native American Student and Community Center

properties.Description: The Art Building consists of three levels above ground, a basement level below street level, and attached parking. A retail building adjoins on the south side of the building, which is not part of PSU. The Art Department is headquartered in this building.
properties.Name: Art Building

properties.Description: These buildings house Engineering and Computer Science. It also has the Credence Integrated Circuit Design and Test Lab, the only one in a public school in the United States. The mission of Integrated Circuits Design and Test Laboratory is to establish a local, regional and national focal point for innovative research and education in the area of integrated circuit design and test.
properties.Name: Maseeh College of Engineering and Computer Science, Fourth Avenue Building

properties.Description: The School of Business Administration includes accounting, business administration, management, and marketing.
properties.Name: School of Business Administration

properties.Description: The College of Urban and Public Affairs is nationally recognized for its research and programs and includes the departments of Political Science, Criminology and Criminal Justice, Public Health, Community Health, and Urban Studies & Planning. The Urban Plaza also features retail space occupied by the PSU Bookstore, Pizzicato, Rice Junkies, The Green Line Market, Ben and Jerry's, and Starbucks Coffee. Transportation & Parking Services is located on the ground floor adjacent to the MAX light-rail system. The Bike Hub is located next to the Transportation & Parking Services offices and offers discounted bicycle parts, maintenance tutorials, and repair services for Portland State's large bicycle commuter population. The Outdoor Program offices and gear rental are located on the south side of the ground floor. They are responsible for the coordination of numerous trips and outings throughout the year. They also have an extensive list of outdoor gear which can be rented to PSU Students.
properties.Name: Urban Plaza, PSU Bookstore, Academic & Student Recreation Center, Transportation & Parking, Bike Hub, Outdoor Program
properties.Address: SW Montgomery St, between SW 6th & 5th Ave

properties.Description: The University Welcome Center is the front desk for the Office of Undergraduate Admissions and New Student Programs. This is a place for all new students and guests to check in for campus tours and receive information about Portland State. Located on the first floor of the Academic and Student Recreation Center, you are invited to stop in during normal business hours to speak with a current student or an Admissions Representative for more detailed questions.
properties.Name: University Welcome Center

properties.Description: PSU offers a variety of housing options to suit our diverse population of students. There are traditional first year programs as well as housing for upperclassmen. Historic Buildings: St. Helens, King Albert, Stratford, Parkway, Montgomery, Blackstone. Modern: Blumel, Epler, Ondine, Broadway.
properties.Name: Housing at Portland State University

properties.Description: Collaborative Live Science Building is a joint venture between Portland State University, Oregon State University and Oregon Health & Science University. Opened in June 2014, CLSB will house Biology and Chemistry courses, research labs and faculty. PSU's largest lecture hall is here, seating 500 students. You can get to this building by riding the Streetcar or walking east toward the waterfront, from the main campus.
properties.Name: Collaborative Life Science Building
